result.execSummary:
The defendant Lloyd D Bergmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lloyd D Bergmann

records.addlTxt: Remedial Contempt Order

Defendant, Lloyd D Bergmann appeared by phone. N. Bergstrom appeared for Lincoln County. Cases are called. County is heard. Bergmann acknowledges failure to pay. Court makes finding of contempt. Court orders 30 days jail STAYED with huber, payment plan in the amount of $100 per month beginning on May 1 and every month thereafter until balance is paid in full. Jail as sanction does not satisfy balance. Purge will be set at $880 if taken into custody.
Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions
Notice and Order to Show Cause

Defendant, Lloyd D Bergmann appeared. Nancy Bergstrom appears for Lincoln County. Cases are called. County heard. Bergmann heard. Bergmann acknowledges contempt. Deft claims that he has not worked since June 2016. Also reports medical issue. Court makes finding of contempt. Court will withhold sanction and review in three months. Mailing address will remain the same. Hearing to be rescheduled.
Notice and Order to Show Cause
Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions
